cnbrrr: Interface to Czech National Bank ARAD Data API

cnbrrr

R package for accessing data from the Czech National Bank’s ARAD (Aggregated data of the CNB) API.

Installation 

# Install from source
devtools::install_github("petrbouchal/cnbrrr")

# Or install locally
devtools::install()

Setup

Set your ARAD API key as an environment variable:

Sys.setenv(ARAD_API_KEY = "your_api_key_here")

Alternatively, you can pass the API key directly to function calls.

Core Functions

Get Data for Specific Indicators 

library(cnbrrr)

# Get data for a single indicator
data <- arad_get_data("SRUMD08402C")

# Get data for multiple indicators
data <- arad_get_data(c("SRUMD08402C", "SRUMD08401C"))

# Get raw data without processing
raw_data <- arad_get_data("SRUMD08402C", process_data = FALSE)

Get and Filter Data Series 

# Get December data for all years
dec_data <- arad_get_series("SRUMD08402C", filter_month = 12)

# Get data for 2023 only
data_2023 <- arad_get_series("SRUMD08402C", filter_year = 2023)

# Get data with custom value column name
spending <- arad_get_series("SRUMD08402C", 
                           filter_month = 12,
                           rename_value = "spending")

Discover Available Data 

# Get list of all available indicators
indicators <- arad_get_indicators()

# Search for specific indicators
monetary_indicators <- arad_get_indicators(search = "monetary")

# Filter by category
category_indicators <- arad_get_indicators(category = "fiscal")

Get Metadata and Categories 

# Get metadata for specific indicators
metadata <- arad_get_metadata(c("SRUMD08402C", "SRUMD08401C"))

# Get all available categories
categories <- arad_get_categories()

# Get subcategories of a parent category
subcategories <- arad_get_categories(parent_category = "monetary")

Utility Functions 

# Validate indicator IDs
valid_ids <- arad_validate_indicators(c("SRUMD08402C", "INVALID_ID"))

# Parse ARAD date format
dates <- arad_parse_date(c("20231201", "20231101"))

# Format data with consistent structure
formatted_data <- arad_format_data(raw_data, value_name = "gdp")

# Get example indicator IDs
examples <- arad_example_indicators()

Example Workflow 

library(cnbrrr)
library(dplyr)
library(ggplot2)

# 1. Discover available indicators
indicators <- arad_get_indicators(search = "GDP")
print(head(indicators))

# 2. Get data for a specific indicator
gdp_data <- arad_get_series("SRUMD08402C", 
                           filter_month = 12,  # December data only
                           rename_value = "gdp")

# 3. Analyze the data
gdp_summary <- gdp_data %>%
  filter(year >= 2010) %>%
  summarise(
    mean_gdp = mean(gdp, na.rm = TRUE),
    latest_year = max(year, na.rm = TRUE),
    latest_gdp = gdp[year == latest_year][1]
  )

# 4. Visualize
gdp_data %>%
  filter(year >= 2010) %>%
  ggplot(aes(x = year, y = gdp)) +
  geom_line() +
  geom_point() +
  labs(title = "GDP Trend", 
       x = "Year", 
       y = "GDP") +
  theme_minimal()

Error Handling

The package includes comprehensive error handling:

# Invalid API key
try(arad_get_data("SRUMD08402C", api_key = "invalid"))
#> Error: Failed to retrieve data from ARAD API: ...

# Invalid indicator ID
try(arad_get_metadata("INVALID_ID"))
#> Error: At least one indicator ID must be provided.

# Network issues are handled gracefully

Data Format

All functions return data frames with consistent column naming:

  • period: Date object (parsed from YYYYMMDD format)
  • value: Numeric data values
  • year: Extracted year from period
  • month: Extracted month from period
  • quarter: Extracted quarter from period (when applicable)

API Endpoints

The package accesses these ARAD API endpoints:

  • /aradb/api/v1/data - Time series data
  • /aradb/api/v1/indicators - Available indicators
  • /aradb/api/v1/metadata - Indicator metadata
  • /aradb/api/v1/categories - Data categories
